Building References¶

Current curated reference files for compatible alignment programs are included when installing RiboPipe for S. cerevisiae only due to file hosting size limits. In order to use organisms other than yeast with RiboPipe, sub-modules are included that will generate these curated reference files formatted for compatibility with RiboPipe.

Generating Curated Reference¶

Currently, curated references compatible with RiboPipe can be generated for the following model organisms: Homo sapiens (STAR)

RiboPipe is easily adaptable to allow curation of other organisms as the need arises. Future updates will allow for increased breadth of model organisms.

In order to generate these references, follow the example below:

  1. Create a directory where ever convenient that will be used to store references:
$ cd ~/references

2) Run RiboPipe’s curate sub-module, specifying references directory created in previous step (or previously created for another curated reference):

$ ribopipe curate -l /path/to/reference/ -p STAR -r human -c 16

If a model organism for a compatible alignment software is not available, please contact us and we can aid in generating a different curated reference file.

Using a Curated Reference with RiboPipe¶

Once a curated reference has been generated, slightly different parameters must be used with RiboPipe’s riboseq and rnaseq sub-modules.

Provide the -c or --custom flags Provide the full path to the reference folder with the -r or --reference flags, such as in the example below:

$ ribopipe riboseq -i /path/to/input -o /path/to/output ... \
-c -r /scratch/general/lustre/u0690617/references/human_reference_star

If using alignment software other than STAR, the -p or --program flags still need to be provided with the appropriate software name
